instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: No sound Early 2014 MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Working on a MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2014 with no sound output.  It chimes when you reset the PRAM but after it boot it has no audio and the sound icon is greyed out.  In the system preferences it reports there are no output devices.  Does not output to the headphones when plugged into the I/O board either.  Also verified that booting from a known good external drive loaded with El Capitan has the same NO AUDIO issues. Pointers on where to start looking on the board for issues ?

threads.title: No sound Early 2014 MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Forgot to mention that I ran the ASD 3S156 on this unit and it passed all tests.

threads.title: No sound Early 2014 MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Almost all the time I faced with this issue, it was fixed after deeply clean of headphone jack.
YouTube has some videos about that...
If that doesn't solve your problem, try another LIO board.
Be sure to have the correct LIO model.
LIO board with camera connector doesn't match your machine...

threads.title: No sound Early 2014 MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Almost all audio is on the DC in board so try a known good DC in board and flat cable. If

threads.title: No sound Early 2014 MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Changed the IO board with one we thought was good and that threw us off for a bit.  Ordered in a new one and that resolved the problem.
